semantic_title: Acute Traumatic Versus Chronic or Recurrent Musculoskeletal Conditions Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 13. Chapter 13: Diseases of the Musculoskeletal System and Connective Tissue > b. Acute traumatic versus chronic or recurrent musculoskeletal conditions

content.full_text: Many musculoskeletal conditions are a result of previous injury or trauma to a site, or are recurrent conditions. Bone, joint or muscle conditions that are the result of a healed injury are usually found in chapter 13. Recurrent bone, joint or muscle conditions are also usually found in chapter 13. Any current, acute injury should be coded to the appropriate injury code from chapter 19. Chronic or recurrent conditions should generally be coded with a code from chapter 13. If it is difficult to determine from the documentation in the record which code is best to describe a condition, query the provider. (Evidence: pg no: 61, L37-L39)
content.summary: Distinguish between acute traumatic injuries (Chapter 19) and chronic/recurrent musculoskeletal conditions (Chapter 13) based on documentation (Evidence: pg no: 61, L37-L39)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Bone, joint or muscle conditions that are the result of a healed injury are usually found in chapter 13 (Evidence: pg no: 61, L37-L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Conditions resulting from previously healed injuries are coded using Chapter 13 musculoskeletal codes (Evidence: pg no: 61, L37-L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Recurrent bone, joint or muscle conditions are also usually found in chapter 13 (Evidence: pg no: 61, L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Recurrent musculoskeletal conditions are coded using Chapter 13 codes (Evidence: pg no: 61, L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Any current, acute injury should be coded to the appropriate injury code from chapter 19 (Evidence: pg no: 61, L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Current acute injuries require Chapter 19 injury codes, not Chapter 13 musculoskeletal codes (Evidence: pg no: 61, L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Chronic or recurrent conditions should generally be coded with a code from chapter 13 (Evidence: pg no: 61, L38)
detailed_rules.explanation: Chronic and recurrent musculoskeletal conditions are coded using Chapter 13 codes (Evidence: pg no: 61, L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If it is difficult to determine from the documentation in the record which code is best to describe a condition, query the provider (Evidence: pg no: 61, L39)
detailed_rules.explanation: Provider queries are required when documentation is unclear about acute versus chronic nature of condition (Evidence: pg no: 61, L39)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if condition is current acute injury or chronic/recurrent
Step 2: If current acute injury, use Chapter 19 codes
Step 3: If chronic, recurrent, or result of healed injury, use Chapter 13 codes
Step 4: If documentation unclear, query provider
Step 5: Select appropriate code based on determination
